summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions 2240 (2015), 2312 (2016) and 2380 (2017) and Presidential Statement S/PRST/2015/25, 

Reaffirms its commitment to Libya's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity and national unity. 

Welcomes the Secretary-General's report S/2018/807. 

1. Condemns migrant smuggling and human trafficking into, through and from Libya and off its coast, which undermines stabilization and endangers lives. 

2. Decides to renew, for 12 months, authorisations in paragraphs 7, 8, 9 and 10 of resolution 2240 (2015), reaffirms paragraph 11 and reiterates previous resolutions. 

3. Renews reporting requests in paragraphs 17 and 18 of resolution 2240 (2015). 

4. Intends to review the situation and consider renewing the authority provided. 

5. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
